## Task 1: Creating Vectors and a List

### R Code

```r
# Step 1: Define the vectors
Year <- c(1980, 1988, 1996, 1998, 2000, 2002)
mean_weight <- c(71.5, 72.1, 73.7, 74.3, 75.2, 74.7)
Gender <- c("M", "M", "F", "F", "M", "M")
mean_height <- c(179.3, 179.9, 180.5, 180.1, 180.3, 180.4)

# Step 2: Combine these vectors into a named list
mylist <- list(Year = Year, mean_weight = mean_weight, Gender = Gender, mean_height = mean_height)

# Access the 4th element in two ways:
# Method 1: Using index
fourth_element_index <- mylist[[4]]

# Method 2: Using the name
fourth_element_name <- mylist$mean_height

# Print the result
fourth_element_index
fourth_element_name
```

## Task 2: Weight Before and After Diet Program

### R Code

```r
# Step 1: Define vectors for weights before and after the program
before <- c(78, 72, 78, 79, 105)
after <- c(67, 65, 79, 70, 93)

# Step 2: Create a data frame to organize the data
weight_data <- data.frame(Before = before, After = after)

# Step 3: Create a matrix as another way to represent the data
weight_matrix <- cbind(Before = before, After = after)

# Print the results
weight_data
weight_matrix
```

## Task 3: Matrix Calculations

### R Code

```r
# Step 1: Create matrix A with repeating patterns
A <- matrix(c(rep(1, 10), rep(3, 10), rep(5, 10)), nrow = 10, ncol = 3, byrow = TRUE)

# Step 2: Create matrix B with a different set of patterns
B <- matrix(c(rep(1, 10), rep(3, 10), rep(5, 10)), nrow = 10, ncol = 3, byrow = TRUE)

# Perform various calculations:
scaled_A <- 2 * A
scaled_B <- 5 * B
difference <- (1/3) * A - (1/3) * B
sum_matrix <- A + B

# Display results
list(scaled_A, scaled_B, difference, sum_matrix)
```

## Task 4: Merging Data Frames

### R Code

```r
# Step 1: Creating the first data frame
students_group1 <- data.frame(
  StudentName = c("Alice", "Bob", "Charlie", "David", "Eve"),
  FatherName = c("John", "Peter", "Mike", "Steve", "Paul"),
  SemesterCGPA = c(3.8, 3.6, 3.7, 3.9, 3.5),
  MarksPercentage = c(85, 87, 90, 92, 88)
)

# Step 2: Creating the second data frame
students_group2 <- data.frame(
  StudentName = c("Frank", "Grace"),
  FatherName = c("Mark", "Tom"),
  SemesterGPA = c(3.4, 3.9),
  MarksPercentage = c(80, 93)
)

# Step 3: Merging the two data frames
all_students <- rbind(students_group1, students_group2)

# Print the merged data frame
all_students
```
